thread.title: ATF: Fire at Texas mosque ruled arson; $30,000 in rewards offered
thread.title_full: ATF: Fire at Texas mosque ruled arson; $30,000 in rewards offered

author: USA Today Network
title: ATF: Fire at Texas mosque ruled arson; $30,000 in rewards offered
text:
The fire that destroyed the Victoria Islamic Center Mosque on Jan. 28, 2017, is being called arson by the authorities. (Photo: Contributed photo/ATF) 
89 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE VICTORIA, Texas â€” Less than two weeks after the Victoria Islamic Center went up in flames, officials have determined it was arson.
The Houston field division of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives, along with the state fire marshal's office, the Victoria fire marshal and the Department of Public Safety began an investigation after the Victoria Fire Department put the fire out Jan. 28.
USA TODAY
Jews open temple to Muslims after mosque burns down
According to an ATF news release, the fire engulfed the building and caused $500,000 in damage.
"The investigative agencies have classified the fire as incendiary, or intentionally set," according to the news release. "At this time, the evidence does not indicate the fire was a biased crime."
Victoria Fire Chief Taner Drake said investigators are working "feverishly" to follow tips that could lead to the arrest of the person or people who set the fire, the news release states.
The ATF and Victoria mosque are each offering a $10,000 reward and Crime Stoppers is offering up to $10,000 for information leading to the arrest and indictment of the person or people responsible for this crime.
As of Wednesday, a GoFundMe page set up to raise donations to rebuild the center has raised more than $1.1 million. The goal was $850,000.
